page.title: 12CUSTOMS
page.content: Bridgwater Carnival is the largest in the country. The atmosphere is incredible! The people love it. It is held on the Thursday nearest to Bonfire Night. The procession starts at 7p.m. and finishes at about 9.45 p.m.. About 40,000 people come to watch it from all over the country. It starts at Parkway and finishes at Broadway Lido. Last year 125 carts were entered. Clubs are entered from all over the county. Squibbing takes place after the Carnival and this is always held in the High Street. Squibs are large fireworks held aloft by a stick.
